cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest then north and finally northeast, moving up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England after crossing the Florida peninsula and the Southeast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass FL; Storm-Surge Watch west of the Aucilla River to the Ochlockonee River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Florida Keys (Craig Key to Dry Tortugas) and Florida west coast Flamingo to Ochlockonee River; Storm-Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and west coast, Florida Big Bend, coastal Georgia, the Carolinas, and northward along the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions (20–30 mph gusts) more likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Chesapeake Bay; any rise likely below 1 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rainfall could bring 1–2 inches to the Baltimore area Friday, with localized heavier pockets possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands as the system passes to the southeast.
